ygData.subject: Info from Yahoo Groups
ygData.msgSnippet: Here is some more info.  If you use this mailing list on a purely e-mail basis, then nothing needs to be done.  If you use the website though, you ll want to
ygData.messageBody:
Here is some more info. If you use this mailing list on a purely e-mail
basis, then nothing needs to be done. If you use the website though, you'll
want to go get your account converted.

Galtin of E'ci


===========
Special Announcement for eGroups Users

Dear eGroups Member,

As you may already know, eGroups merged with Yahoo! in August 2000. We're
now proud to announce the launch of Yahoo! Groups, a new service from Yahoo!
using eGroups technology.


What Happened to eGroups?

All the features you know and love about eGroups have carried over and we've
added some new functionality that we hope you'll enjoy.
Don't worry, all eGroups email and web addresses will continue to work, and
all of your group information and membership has been maintained.

We'll soon begin to internationalize Yahoo! Groups. In the interim, you can
continue to use the international versions of eGroups.

What's new on Yahoo! Groups?

Yahoo! Groups has lots of new features and even better customization. You
can:
Chat with other group members using our improved Yahoo! Chat
Add a splash of color to your group, or a main page photo, all without
knowing HTML
See when group members are online and communicate with them in real time
using Yahoo! Messenger
Reach a larger audience - you will have the entire Yahoo! Network at your
doorstep
And much, much more to come!
The best part -- you don't have to do anything to convert your group. This
has all happened automatically. All you have to do to access the wide array
of web functionality is link your current eGroups account with a Yahoo! ID
by clicking on the "Convert my eGroups account" link below.

And remember, if you would like to continue using only the email
capabilities of the service, you won't need a Yahoo ID. You will continue to
receive and post mail, just like you always have in the past.

For a detailed FAQ on merger topics, please go here.

On behalf of everyone here at Yahoo! Groups, thanks for being a member of
our service.

Sincerely,

The Yahoo! Groups team
==============

Convert to Egroups account to Yahoo Groups account:
http://groups.yahoo.com/convwiz




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
